TestDescription.name: Apache 2.x version older than 2.2.8

WASPDescription.DetailsFormat: The script has been tested with these parameter values : ${combinations}

TestDescription.Description:
[coolbox][dark]This alert was generated using only banner information. It may be a false positive. [/dark][/coolbox][break][bold]Fixed in Apache httpd 2.2.8:[/bold][break][ul]
[li] [bold]low[/bold]: mod_proxy_ftp UTF-7 XSS CVE-2008-0005[break]
A workaround was added in the mod_proxy_ftp module. On sites where mod_proxy_ftp is enabled and a forward proxy is configured, a cross-site scripting attack is possible against Web browsers which do not correctly derive the response character set following the rules in RFC 2616. [/li]
[li] [bold]low[/bold]: mod_proxy_balancer DoS CVE-2007-6422[break]
A flaw was found in the mod_proxy_balancer module. On sites where mod_proxy_balancer is enabled, an authorized user could send a carefully crafted request that would cause the Apache child process handling that request to crash. This could lead to a denial of service if using a threaded Multi-Processing Module. [/li]
[li] [bold]low[/bold]: mod_proxy_balancer XSS CVE-2007-6421[break]
A flaw was found in the mod_proxy_balancer module. On sites where mod_proxy_balancer is enabled, a cross-site scripting attack against an authorized user is possible.
[/li]
[li] [bold]moderate[/bold]: mod_status XSS CVE-2007-6388[break]
A flaw was found in the mod_status module. On sites where mod_status is enabled and the status pages were publicly accessible, a cross-site scripting attack is possible. Note that the server-status page is not enabled by default and it is best practice to not make this publicly available.
[/li]
[li] [bold]moderate[/bold]: mod_imagemap XSS CVE-2007-5000[break]
A flaw was found in the mod_imagemap module. On sites where mod_imagemap is enabled and an imagemap file is publicly available, a cross-site scripting attack is possible.
[/li]
[/ul][break]
[navy]Affected Apache versions (up to 2.2.6).[/navy][break]
TestDescription.Impact: Check references for details about every vulnerability.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade Apache 2.x to the latest version.
